intro: Ixora raivavaensis, commonly known as the Raivavae ixora, is a flowering plant native to the island of Raivavae in the French Polynesian Society. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it visually striking. Ixora raivavaensis is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
